definitions.definition: To provide with gearing; to fit with gears in order to achieve a desired gear ratio .
To be in gear , come into gear.
To dress ; to put gear on; to harness .
) To design or devise (something) so as to be suitable (for a particular type of person or a particular purpose).
examples: This shop is not really geared towards people of our age.
They have geared the hotel mainly at tourists.

definitions.definition: To borrow money in order to invest it in assets.

main_definition: ( engineering , transitive ) To provide with gearing; to fit with gears in order to achieve a desired gear ratio .
secondary_definitions: ( engineering , intransitive ) To be in gear , come into gear.
To dress ; to put gear on; to harness .
( usually with to or toward(s) ) To design or devise (something) so as to be suitable (for a particular type of person or a particular purpose).
( finance ) To borrow money in order to invest it in assets.
